```{=html}
<section id="bio" class="panel">

  <div class="inner">
    

    <div class="bio-grid">
      <div class="bio-photo">
        <img src="assets/images/profile.png" class="profile-image" alt="Portrait of Sabrina Henry">
      </div>

      <div class="bio-text">
        <h2 class="hero-subtitle">Bio</h2>

        <p>
          I started my PhD in 2024 in the
          <a href="https://quantum-optics.site.hw.ac.uk/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
            Quantum Optics and Computational Imaging group
          </a>
          at
          <a href="https://www.hw.ac.uk/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
            Heriot-Watt University
          </a>
          in Edinburgh. My research explores building user trust in deep learning models when applied to high-stakes domains such as
          healthcare and security, with a focus on model interpretability. Much of my work is applied to analysing data from quantum devices and is reported under the
          <a href="https://qusit.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
            UK Quantum Technology Research Hub in Sensing Imaging and Timing
          </a>
          and the
          <a href="https://qepnt.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
            UK Hub for Quantum Enabled Position, Navigation and Timing
          </a>.
        </p>

        <p>
          I graduated from Heriot-Watt with a masters degree in Physics, during which I conducted research into using fluroescence lifetime imaging and spectroscopy to monitor the uptake of drugs used in cancer treatments and was awarded the
          <a href="https://www.rankprize.org/news-events/16-students-to-complete-summer-projects/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
            Rank Prize Undergraduate Vacation Scholarship
          </a>
          where I developed computational methods for enhancing the resolution of fluroesence lifetime images obtained using single-photon detectors. It was during this time I became interested in deep learning and decided to pursue a PhD.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>

  </div>
</section>
```

```{=html}
<section id="research" class="panel">
  <div class="inner">

    <h2 class="hero-subtitle">Research</h2>

    <p class="section-desc">
      The first year of my PhD has involved developing a post-hoc, gradient-based attribution method that links the features (pixels) in an image to the influence they had on a model's decision. Unlike other gradient-based attribution methods, the Self-Guided Integrated Gradient Method for Attribution (SIGMA) stochastically explores a models noisy confidence landscape, following a model's decision boundery to indentify input features that result in a models collapse in confidence. A recent personal project has been creating interactive articles to showcase my work, click on a project below to explore what I have been up to! Full length versions of my publications and preprints are also linked below.
```
